utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh it's a pleasure to meet you, Jeanne.

utterances.transcript: %Uh this year or next year, huh?

utterances.transcript: So I'm planning to %um visit Singapore %uh probably in July if given the chance this year, July, this year.

utterances.speaker: Tourist

utterances.transcript: %Uh Chinatown is in South Bridge Road area just separated by the river and you walk a little bit and you'll reach Peninsula Plaza.

utterances.transcript: And you can also eat there and then you can walk to the shops but they haven't- the camera shops haven't put themselves online.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, when it comes to food do you have %uh anything listed about Filipino restaurants near the area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you come in- on a weekend and you want to meet Filipinos and eat Filipino food you go to what we called Little Filipino- Little Philippines.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's where all the Filipinos congregate and so on the fourth and fifth floors %uh we have what si~ shops serving just Filipinos.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Lucky~ But it's not actually a place it's more of an event like it happens-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- No, it's a shopping centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A very old one down in Orchard Road which is the shopping area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you getting it on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see Lucky Plaza when the there's a map, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are buses from Chinatown to Orchard Road so if you come and you include a Sunday on your visit on Sunday you go up there and you'll see lots of Filipinos you can get perhaps a better variety of Filipino food because Sunday is when- well are assumed to be off work, yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, I'll take note of that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sunday and- is there a particular time or just during that the whole day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the whole day you can get lunch, dinner there but you want to eat Filipino food in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe, you know, if- ever I get homesick- Just for the day. It's for-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just for the day. It's for-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I believe there's a stall at the airport also run by a Filipino.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I can't remember at which It's actually at the place where %uh the staff eat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a staff canteen but you can go there and I used to eat there, Filipino food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm if I go- if I'm including Sunday in my travel list is- I'll also go to church- %uh the Christian church.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there a Christian church nearby?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like- it can be Baptist but, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not really Catholic but Christian- I think there's a New Life Christian Centre %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I am not sure, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, Christian Centre or- the biggest here in the Philippines %uh we do have that in several sites as well accross the country.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I put in Singapore and I'll try and get you the address.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have New Life Community Church.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you recognise which one is affiliated to your church?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm it should be New Life Vineyard Church.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe you can check that, the Vineyard Church one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is an interesting part of Singapore also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can do some tasting of Chinese food-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if I'm not mistaken there's also a Filipino restaurant there %uh because I was there recently and I passed it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Brunch gathering- Okay, yes, it is Christian.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And does it, is it %uh nearby or do I have to travel by bus?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. This one you need to take a bus %uh because the trains don't go exactly there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it's an interesting quarter of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Then maybe %uh there are lot of sights to see, I guess.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, %um there are food especially to try.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A blend of Chinese and Malay food and as I said there is a Filipino %uh like a café there-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: This is New Life Vineyard Church.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- Yah, and it's at One Eight Three East Coast Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh how many minutes of %uh travel by bus-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Number Ten East West number thirty two.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um you see the instructions at the bottom here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We're directly opposite the OCBC Bank.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, I think allow yourself forty five minutes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, so that's a bit too far, I guess.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm listing all of the %uh places that I've asked about %uh from the start of our conversation here, okay, %hm. Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Forty five minutes so if this- I've I missed the first service it's about thirty, okay, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get the- what is the services.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, it's at eleven thirty A.M.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I need to be on the bus at ten thirty, I guess.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because on Sundays it's off peak for public transport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How is the traffic in %uh Singapore on Sundays?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the buses %uh don't come as frequently as they do during %uh office days and of peak hours.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Peak hours they send many more buses in the early mornings and in the evenings when people are going to work and coming back.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is why you need to allow time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But then on the trains it's only about four minutes or five minutes off peak the most.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %uh does the traffic get pretty congested on Sundays or not really?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- Yah, it's more relaxing on Sundays.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the forty five-minute travel time by bus is pretty much %uh smooth ride without-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: traffic jams and things like that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the farthest place so far in my online list is the church.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could go all the way North and visit the Night Safari if you want.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But what kind of place is that, Jeanne?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like all of it the nocturnal animals can be viewed there, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Say what are your interest back in Philippines?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What do you like to do?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I love- mainly I love those geek stuff I mentioned earlier.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I love geek stuff but I also like travelling.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %hm like I'm interested in beaches as well but not like, you know, my friends here they are very much %uh into %uh beaches and stuff, like that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But is there a beach somewhere?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: To relax and, you know, enjoy the sun.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I know it can get very hot in July, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm gonna get you a beach in Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how far is that from my hotel do you think?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From your hotel you could go by train and then I'll get to the train section a little bit later.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I don't think %uh, you know, my destinations can be %uh visited in just one day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, I can see the website from here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Siloso, is that %um a Singaporean term for something?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we were told it's a Filipino term for jealousy.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But is the owner Filipino by any chance?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. Siloso is just the name of this stretch of the beach on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can eat there, you know, %uh there are bistros you could- there are also like ice cream parlors.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have beach parties also sometimes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: In Siloso Beach- at Siloso Beach?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's another beach called Tanjong Beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh Sentosa Island has attractions also but this is just the beach area I'm showing you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Wait %uh let's  %uh- No %uh let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You see, on the island they have free bus service to bring you so you could go to both beaches.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can take- let me get on the MRT for Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is our Mass Rapid Transit system.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, I can see the map, right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and you can go all the way down here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you- And you can connect down to %uh Raffles Place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or- you can connect down to- sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you change to go to Dhoby Ghaut %uh which is a major interchange and then you take another train you're down right into Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So Chi~ Huh, so how about the travel duration?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How many minutes would it take me from the beach to the Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So from Chinatown you just take a train to HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, I guess %uh the travel time is pretty quick.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Including walking up and down the steps and everything maybe twenty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The ride itself would be- maybe five minutes, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Two and a half minutes, very short.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then here you take a shuttle into Sentosa which is at the bus station within walking distance.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You walk about five minutes and where the public buses stop you can take a Sentosa bus in for one dollar.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I've never been to Singapore and thank you for giving me all these wonderful travel destinations.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm just curious 'cause I've never been there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh the navigation is it easy like I can just read bulletin boards and street signs in English? Are

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: is it easy like I can just read bulletin boards and street signs in English? Are all of them are in English, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh the bus stops have the entire route for- not the entire route but the route of the buses where they're going to go.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just- if you're taking a public bus you just need to be on the correct side of the road so you can ask anybody at the bus stop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They'll be able to tell you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh when you are at the airport go down to the MRT Station and buy a card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you need to pay a small deposit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think it's about ten dollars or seven dollars which you get back %uh when you go back home.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And maybe there's a small charge for making the card, you know, just a nominal fee.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But the deposit- you put extra deposit is for your travel fare so you don't have to worry about carrying the correct amount of money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I'm pretty sure- %uh is it safe to assume that my lo~ my credit card will be accepted in most of the merchants or shops there in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At the IT Shops %uh I think they would accept.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At the major stores they would accept, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you pay it on the streets in Chinatown if you buy souvenir say three souvenirs for ten dollars then they would not accept.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You might want to change it when you arrive at the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- That - if you are staying just two days there's no point hunting for a money changer who usually gives a slightly better rate.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And the- I can do money changing at the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can change at the airport and then go to the basement where the MRTs which stands for Mass Rapid Transit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So once you've got your local money you can buy your travel card and they will supply you a map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At least they used to a map and they can both also be very informative.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: About how to travel, you know, if you're not sure there they will give you very good directions.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now, I think I have a few more questions. I have asked for the Funan Centre, the museum, the beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now, I think I have a few more questions. I have asked for the Funan Centre, the museum, the beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Any- %uh do you have any recommendations on %uh like natural scenic spots in Singapore like that, know, things like that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: One of my best %uh places is this place and you should bring your binoculars if you're going.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But there are also places that you can just do a walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this one you have to travel because it's in the North and you are in the South of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's gonna be pretty far I believe.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So is it Sungei Buloh Wetlands Museum?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sungei is a bamboo and Buloh?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No Sungei is a river and Buloh is river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Buloh is bamboo and- so river bamboo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you go at low tide or even high tide you can see mudskipper- %uh you can see a %uh tree climbing crabs.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you come in December you can see migratory birds.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that fly from %um %uh- as far away as Mongolia and some continue to Perth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can take a train up to Kranji.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you take this bus called the Kranji Express.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see a timetable.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So at the Kranji when you get out of the train you come out on the road you wait for this bus and you pay him three dollars for a two-way transfer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you're at Sungei Buloh check out the times that they leave Sungei Buloh back to the station so you can time yourself on your walk.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I have nick~ %uh Sungei- How do you pronounce that Sungei?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then- or you can continue on the bus and just visit other places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is just some of them that he will drop you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hay Dairies they have got goats from all over the world.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh and the- like the whole place this %uh Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve is it like an open space or like wildness~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you want to watch migratory birds in December then- Oh anyway from September to March then you need like half a day or one day there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh because I need to wait  for the birds to mi~ to do the migrating thing, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. %Uh they will be there but the thing is you might enjoy it and walk around and there are trails over the %uh marine life and trails over %uh ponds %uh in there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you're a birder, a twitter, they may normally spend half a day there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you just want to see then you can continue on the bus and visit the rest of the places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I have lots of destinations.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I already have lots of destinations here listed.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh my favourite would be, of course, %uh Funan Centre and %uh maybe the beach, yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna- I have to check that out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have attractions %uh if you want like the bird park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have the Jurong Bird Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are lazy to %uh look at birds, you know, through your binoculars you want them in your face-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I don't think I would love birds on my face though but it's okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can see them- There you can have them flying right in front of you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well I've always been %uh fascinated with birds- %uh fascinated by the, you know, wildlife, right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- %Uh this one is not so wild because it's an attraction but Sungei Buloh is wild.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Let me take note of that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you want more information on wild places %uh you- when you come in to Singapore you might want to contact someone from %uh Nature Society and we have nature guides there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are the more hardcore people, you know.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The more- What do you call them?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a- Yes, but there are guides in there that can help you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or like you can see horseshoe crab.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So just remember this %uh website when you come and see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are public walks that you can join.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, I can see the website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the- This is focused on wilderness whereas places like the zoo and the bird park is more attractive, you know, for tourists who don't want to get too muddy or dirty or-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well for- %uh any other tips when I'm- while I'm in Singapore like %um- are there any %uh how do I say this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm guidelines, things that I should not do on the streets, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you should walk %uh at traffic light junctions and, you know, you should walk carefully.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's actually for your own safety because the traffic can be, you know, %uh they follow traffic rules but people are used to people not walking when the lights are red so you should just follow the rules there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yah, you can bring in gum to chew if you need to chew gum but just don't bring in great quantities because you're not allowed to import chewing gum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can chew it but you can't import it because if you stick the gum in the wrong place you can stop the trains from moving.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's why we have the rule because %uh if there's no total contact the doors don't shut properly the trains get stuck.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we can't afford to have people chewing gum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it okay to like, you know, use my camera and just take pictures of people and, you know, random places or is there a regulation- some kind of regulation about my camera use?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you're in a place of worship %uh it's better not to photograph people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and maybe you want to ask the temple people before you do the photographing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you're photographing the architecture like the statues %uh the facade that's-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And in the airport I don't think they want you to use your camera.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I don't think so too.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm just curious about- since you mentioned temple what is the %uh common religion in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have all religions in Singapore %uh but %um as the majority three quarters of us are Chinese.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Buddhism and Taoism is very %uh visible in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In fact, within walking distance of your hotel there is a fairly new Buddhist temple and it's huge.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: At the what- that's something that I would like to visit, the temples.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I propose you visit another one that is further away.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can walk too but it's not so near as this new temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Telok Ayer Street is just one street away from where you are.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, I love that infrastructure right there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What do you call that building?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But is there a- like %uh a more common noun name for it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Unfortunately, the street name is also- This name is Chinese dialect.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The street name is Telok Ayer Street which is-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, which is Water Bay Street.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, oldest most Singaporean tem~ I can see like a temple over~ the temple overview, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh if you go there you allow some time to visit %uh mosque, %hm- two doors away from it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just been newly renovated again but it's about as old as this temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This temple actually dates from the eighteen twenties when it was a little shrine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's one of the oldest in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh are there monks there now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I mean, you know, like I get to see them-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. I'm afraid it's a bit more like a tourist attraction except on feast days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the one way you get to see a lot of monks is the one very near %uh Buddha Tooth Relic.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Thian Hock Keng is a Buddhist and Taoist so you get a lot of other deities that are common to both religions but here you get mostly Buddha.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I- I'm sorry but I cannot take pictures of those deities, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think you ask whoever looks like a monk in there first before you take the photograph.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so as not to offend them, it would be a bit better.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But also what you're trying to say is that there's a chance that they would allow you to do that or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, they might if you look very obviously like a tourist.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You know, is it - I hope I would look like a- very much like a tourist to them when I visit there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can I show you the- these photos here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So this is the most recent photograph of this building, is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This one is just a few years old but the other one it has been restored but %uh the last time I went about a month ago they are still restoring parts of it so maybe the back you can't go.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: This is the Buddha Tooth Relic.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And you can go inside this building or maybe-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh make sure you use the side door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The there are doors in the centre and doors to the left and right of the centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, the main door is for the temple priest to go in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is- This one is also in Chinatown and it's a heritage temple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And do these temples or, you know, tourist temple attractions %uh ask for entrance fees and %uh things like that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do they ask you for, you know, like a ticket-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. %Uh but here the tem~ %uh the Sri Mariamman if you use your camera inside they'll ask you for a camera fees.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, this %eh- Are those, %uh, statues of people?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The those are statues so it's very spectacular for %uh photography.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see the pictures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this is very- %uh this is- has a very authentic view because people are still %uh praying here they're worshiping here so you should go in the morning before twelve.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They close from about twelve to about four, four thirty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They have a short break and then they re-open in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So either that or you go in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So before twelve they should come to this place bef~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, if you want to use your camera you get better light also.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And they're closed between twelve and four?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they have a small door open you can get in but inside there's no activity, there's nobody praying, you know, it's- the temple priests are not around.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So this is another destination for me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The temples are very interesting and they're very %uh perfect for, you know, %uh camera enthusiasts and photos and things like-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, I see I have- Well, you-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, %um I think %uh that would be all.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You've been very helpful and informative.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I've learnt a lot about, you know, different things and I'm pretty sure there are a lot of other places to visit %uh given the chance.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %uh as for now I think %uh, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I mean thank you for these wonderful information.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But for now I think I'm all good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Huh, hope to see you too.
